6 - 8 yrs. relevant experience in a dynamic in-house/corporate legal or law firm environment, with familiarity of working across different jurisdictions and with multi-national clients.
  • Additional certifications and experience, including compliance related global professional certification(s) (e.g. data privacy, data governance, Information Security) and/or corporate law and/or company experience, considered a plus.

    • Behaviours and Attributes

    • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English (and other language, depending on geography supported).
    • Enthusiasm for continuous learning and exemplifying a growth mindset.
    • Detail orientated, sound judgement, organized and adaptable.
    • Able to present innovative, original solutions which understand our business, and to act as a strategic thinker.
    • Demonstrated ability to identify, understand and assess trends and developments in functional areas of expertise and to explain issues in a practical, results-focused manner.
    • Experienced in research, including due-diligence, reporting, drafting and presentation skills and proven ability to contextual business need, and embrace a client-centric approach.
    • Demonstrate autonomy, take ownership and drive tasks to closure.
    • Strong time management, ability to work under pressure and display positive approach.
    • Ability to prioritize and make decisions, and possess a high level of common sense, including the ability to see around the corner and spot risks before they materialize.
    • Ability to effectively influence and persuade senior leadership and work collaboratively and build trusted relationships within a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
    • Leadership, people development and/or management experience, managing team and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role).
    • Support to the enablement of our designated locations teams to undertake work of increased complexity, including through industrialization of processes.
    • Commitment to a creative, inclusive, and diverse workplace and recognize the strengths that unique styles, innovative perspectives and experiences bring to Accenture.
    • Strong inter-personal skills and ability to build a sense of belonging in a team and establish a sense of common purpose across Accenture Legal.
    • Open to work with and understand cross-cultures and locations throughout the Accenture global organization and work well with executives and non-executives.
    • Proficiency using Microsoft Office applications (e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and online communication tools.
    • Proactive approach, comfortable with technology and use of tools and databases.
    • Willingness to embrace change, conversant with, and curiosity to explore new and emerging technologies, industry best practices, areas of risk and turn insights to action.
    • Effective management of external counsel, often in multi-jurisdictional context.
